author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Harken, to Publicis' valiant tale clear,
A fleet of wealth riding the ebb of year.
They now foresee their loot to grow,
By five percent, a divine river's flow.

To the tale of HelloFresh, now we shift,
Their shares doth sink, caught in a rift.
Customers flee, their future in doubt,
Despite expectations of a rich dividend sprout.

Now to Givaudan, their earnings shrink,
Lower volumes, their ship's on the brink.
Income and earnings drop from their peak,
A storm has struck; outlooks bleak.

feedItems.title: Publicis Raises Guidance After Steady Second Quarter
feedItems.description: Publicis now forecasts organic revenue growth of around 5% for 2023, with an operating margin close to 18% after it maintained its pace of growth for the second quarter.

feedItems.title: HelloFresh Hit By Lower Customer Numbers
feedItems.description: Shares in HelloFresh fell after the company flagged a loss in active customers in the second quarter and revised downward its revenue-growth outlook for 2023 despite projecting better-than-expected quarterly adjusted earnings.

feedItems.title: Givaudan Earnings Drop as Volumes Drag
feedItems.description: Givaudan said first-half operating income and adjusted earnings came in below the previous year, and lower volumes caused reduced cost absorption.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the kingdom of trade, and fortune’s rule,  
Electrolux saw their earnings drowned in a cruel pool.  
While divestitures silver bright, may yet bring boon,  
Citi’s gaze portends a shadowed swoon.  

Lo! The oil, with slow ascent does take flight,  
After Yank stocks lower fell, despite much might.  
A meager drop, yet with potential might,  
May stir and wake the sleeping serpent's bite.  

Telenor, yon merchant, sings a joyful rune,  
After quarter's gain, beneath the summer's moon.  
Low to mid it calls, growth in Northern tide,  
In Nordic lands, does this prosper reside.

feedItems.title: Electrolux Could See Double Digit FY Consensus Earnings Cuts
feedItems.description: Electrolux earnings missed expectations by a wide margin, and although planned divestitures for around SEK10 billion could be seen as a partial silver lining, Citi sees the potential for double digit percentage cuts to 2023 consensus Ebit.

feedItems.title: Oil Inches Higher Following US Stocks Data
feedItems.description: Oil was little changed following the smaller-than-expected drop in U.S. crude stocks.

feedItems.title: Telenor Backs Views After Second-Quarter Beat
feedItems.description: Telenor posted adjusted underlying earnings and revenue above consensus in the second quarter, and said it still expects low to mid-single digit growth in the Nordics for the full year.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Though dollars charm with modest gain,
Investors shy, "Hold fast to rein."
While sterling’s fall proves but a trifle,
They falter still on greenback's chisel.

In Electrolux's troubled stead,
A loss bemoans, fortunes are shred.
To rid the Zanussi, a futile dance,
A world now shakes with fickle finance.

Next ABB, they rise, though orders wane,
Turning modest growth to golden grain.
Despite what falls in future shade,
A profit's song remains unfrayed.

feedItems.title: Investors Not Rushing Back to Buy Dollars Despite Small Recovery
feedItems.description: The dollar edged lower as a recovery after sterling’s drop on Wednesday following the U.K. inflation data proved short-lived, showing investors aren’t ready to buy into the U.S. currency yet, UniCredit Research said.

feedItems.title: Electrolux Mulls Divestments as Demand Weakens
feedItems.description: Electrolux posted an unexpected second-quarter net loss of SEK648 million and said it was considering selling its Zanussi brand and other non-core assets to raise capital, as it now expects negative demand in all regions in 2023.

feedItems.title: ABB Profits Rise Despite Weaker Orders
feedItems.description: ABB said its operational earnings rose by a quarter to $1.4 billion despite a slight decline in new orders and forecast 2023 comparable revenue growth of at least 10% and an operational Ebita margin above 16%.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
To EasyJet's strong demand in the winter frost,
A hearty profit, no steward nor passenger lost.
God bless the fly-ship, by more than the fifteenth held,
Filled to the brim, like a December ale-vat swelled.

Anglo American, in Peruvian mine nestled,
With copper bountiful, their hands neatly wrestled.
An eleven-score rise 'neath Quellaveco's cloak,
Like God's own blessing poured into his disciples' yoke.

Spanish Bonds they sing a pre-election tune,
Yet still remain as sweet as a June afternoon.
With risk as low as a monk's fine-tuned speech,
Erste does declare it a fruit within reach.

feedItems.title: EasyJet Sees Strong Winter Demand
feedItems.description: EasyJet posted a headline profit of £203 million in the third quarter on higher passenger numbers and reported good booking momentum for winter, with capacity for the December quarter up by more than 15%.

feedItems.title: Anglo American Production Outlook on Track
feedItems.description: Anglo American kept its full-year production guidance after it reported a 11% rise in second-quarter output, reflecting the ramp-up of its Quellaveco copper mine in Peru.

feedItems.title: Spanish Bonds Underperform Pre-Election But Remain Attractive
feedItems.description: Spanish government bonds represent an attractive investment with comparatively low political and moderate fiscal risks, Erste Asset Management said.
